alert.note: Alert for Duval; La Salle; McMullen; Webb (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Corpus Christi (Corpus Cristi, Victoria and Laredo)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 15 at 8:44PM CDT by NWS Corpus Christi
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT NORTHWESTERN DUVAL...SOUTHEASTERN LA SALLE...EASTERN WEBB AND SOUTHERN MCMULLEN COUNTIES THROUGH 930 PM CDT... At 843 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a cluster of strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 10 miles south of Tilden to 17 miles northeast of Ranchitos Las Lomas to 6 miles south of Ranchos Penitas West. Movement was southeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Laredo, Freer, Rio Bravo, Texas A&M, Laredo International Airport, Seven Sisters, Loma Alta, Botines, Unitec Industrial Park, Ranchos Penitas West, United South High School, Aguilares, Ranchitos Las Lomas, St Augustine High School South Laredo, Doctors Hospital Of Laredo, Laredo Country Club, Laredo Community College, Orvil, Callaghan, and Oilton. This includes the following highways... Interstate 35 between mile markers 1 and 27. US Highway 59 between mile markers 746 and 824. US Highway 83 between mile markers 694 and 732. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
